qas.question: How much revenue is generated yearly by London's public bus service?
How many buses does the London public bus network operate?
What feature added in 2007 facilitated bus travel by London' passengers with hearing and vision impairments?
What distinct appearance identifies many buses as a landmark for London?
Typically, what color are London taxi cabs?

context: London's bus network is one of the largest in the world, running 24 hours a day, with about 8,500 buses, <a1_0>more than 700<a1_0/> bus routes and around 19,500 bus stops. In 2013, the network had more than 2 billion commuter trips per annum, more than the Underground. Around <a0_0>£850 million<a0_0/> is taken in revenue each year. London has the largest wheelchair accessible network in the world and, from the 3rd quarter of 2007, became more accessible to hearing and visually impaired passengers as <a2_0>audio-visual announcements<a2_0/> were introduced. The distinctive <a3_0>red double-decker<a3_0/> buses are an internationally recognised trademark of London transport along with <a4_0>black<a4_0/> cabs and the Tube.
